Dear Elmastudio,
I am about to by your werkstatt theme, however was wondering to what extend I can alter the theme? Because I literally am looking for a theme where I can display my pictures (in a gallery to scroll from left to right, as on your cover page) and show my work as a journalist (Articles in PDF form and Radiopieces to download). item.title: Contact
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded: To use forms you can install the Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin or use Jetpack forms feature. After the installation of the plugin just create a new form via the Contact Form 7 settings page and copy/paste the shortcode into a page or post. If you have already installed Jetpack you can activate the Jetpack Contact Form feature under Appearance â Jetpack and then just add your form via the new âAdd Contact Formâ button at the top of your text editor field. Here is an example of the Jetpack contact form: [contact-form][contact-field label='Name' type='name' required='1'/][contact-field label='Email' type='email' required='1'/][contact-field label='Website' type='url'/][contact-field label='Message' type='textarea' required='1'/][/contact-form]

item.title: Strolling Through the Streets of Kyoto
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded:
I remember walking around the cold, windy wintery Kyoto streets of Kyoto and enjoying it a ton even, if it was really very cold during our trip in December last year. We would stop for some hot green tea, before continuing to explore the city.
The city is for sure beautiful in all seasons, but we loved the quite, cold days we spend in Kyoto in December.
I loved the winter scenery, because it is less crowded with tourists and you can see a lot more of the local, normal city life of Kyoto. To stay warm we spend time in book shops and cafÃ©s and in the evening we loved to go to the small little onsen in our hotel.
